    • Constructor Detail

      • DungeonKeep

        public DungeonKeep(int level_id,
                   int guard_type,
                   int ogre_number)
        Basic level constructor
        Parameters:
        level_id - Identifies the level that should be loaded
        guard_type - A number between 1 and 3, that represent a enum type Guard.Type that defines the guards' behaviour
        ogre_number - A number between 0 and 5, where 0 is ignored as a parameter, and the rest define the amount of ogres that spawn in the level (if there is a ogre in the first place)

      • update

        public DungeonKeep.State update(java.lang.String input)
        Method that updates the state of the game based on the input received through the String
        Parameters:
        input - String type that holds a basic form of user input
        Returns:
        Enum type State that after updating every element in the game, describes the state of the player, determining whether he may still play or not. Be aware that this function doesn't enforce the state that it returns, being dependent on the interface whether or not to continue the game after receiving the state.

      • display

        public void display(java.io.PrintStream stream)
        Method that outputs the game map to a stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream type that holds a string representation of the game map
